item.title: Bayesian shared parameter joint models for heterogeneous populations
Smooth normative brain mapping of 3-dimensional morphometry imaging data using skew-normal regression
Demographic factors associated with within-individual variability of lung function for adults with cystic fibrosis: A UK registry study
Quantifying uncertainty in brain-predicted age using scalar-on-image quantile regression
A computational approach to lexical polysemy in Ancient Greek
Development and performance of a diagnostic/prognostic scoring system for breakthrough pain
item.description: Variable prevalence and treatment of breakthrough pain (BTP) in different clinical contexts are partially due to the lack of reliable/validated diagnostic tools with prognostic capability. We report the statistical basis and performance analysis of a novel BTP scoring system based on the naïve Bayes classifier (NBC) approach and an 11-item IQ-BTP validated questionnaire. This system aims at classifying potential BTP presence in three likelihood classes: “High,” “Intermediate,” and “Low.”
